extractions.title: Investigating the Shared Genetic Architecture Between Kidney Function and Alzheimer's Disease Across Ancestries

extractions.trait: Alzheimer's disease (local regions jointly analyzed with eGFR in Europeans)
extractions.method_detail: Local SNP-heritability estimated using LAVA on GWAS summary statistics in regions with significant local genetic correlation between AD and eGFR
extractions.source_text: In EUR, 52 regions showed significant local correlations (Bonferroni‐corrected), and heritability (AD: h² = 0.05, p ≈ 0.025; eGFR: h² = 0.10, p < 1E‐10).
extractions.evidence_html: ...ificant (r g values ≈ 0.07) in both ancestries, with regions of strong local correlations observed. In EUR, 52 regions showed significant local correlations (Bonferroni‐corrected), and heritability (AD: h² = 0.05, p ≈ 0.025; eGFR: h² = 0.10, p < 1E‐10). These regions exhibited balanced bidirectional correlations (26 loci each; positive range: 0.32 to ...

extractions.title: Alzheimer disease is (sometimes) highly heritable: Drivers of variation in heritability estimates for binary traits, a systematic review.

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: GCTA-GREML on individual-level genotype data; ~499,757 directly genotyped SNPs; elderly screened and population controls; first published LOAD GCTA estimate in 2013
extractions.source_text: “The first LOAD GCTA heritability estimates were published in 2013 ( Table 2 and Fig 3 ). The resulting LOAD heritability estimate of 24% was based on a sample of 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,84

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: GCTA-GREML on ADGC individual-level data imputed to HapMap phase II; 2,042,116 SNPs after QC
extractions.source_text: “Concurrently, Ridge et al. (2013) leveraged the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium (ADGC) dataset [ 73 ], including 10,922 individuals (5,708 cases, 5,214 controls), and estimated a higher herit

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: GCTA-GREML on 2016 ADGC update; 21 known AD genes required non-missing; 8,712,879 SNPs imputed from 1000 Genomes reference
extractions.source_text: “The ADGC dataset has since continued to expand, facilitating more comprehensive analyses of LOAD. A 2016 update included data from 30 studies within the ADGC, and the heritability estimate increased
extractions.evidence_html: ...ividuals (5,708 cases, 5,214 controls), and estimated a higher heritability estimate of 33% [ 74 ]. The ADGC dataset has since continued to expand, facilitating more comprehensive analyses of LOAD. A 2016 update included data from 30 studies within the ADGC, and the heritability estimate increased to 53%. This study included only 9,699 individuals (3,877 cases, 5,822 controls) [ 75 ]. This sample size was smaller in this latter study due to the requirement for non-missing data across...

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD), clinically diagnosed (5 cohorts, consistent 5% liability threshold)
extractions.method_detail: Baker et al. 2023; GCTA-GREML across five independent cohorts; consistent liability threshold (K=0.05); estimate represents lower end of reported range for clinically diagnosed LOAD
extractions.source_text: “Baker et al (2023) illustrated this by demonstrating that the histopathologically confirmed LOAD yielded higher heritability estimates (31% - 57%) compared to clinically diagnosed LOAD (12% - 32%) wh
extractions.evidence_html: ... Clinical diagnosis have inherent misdiagnosis rates [ 83 ] that can affect heritability estimates. Baker et al (2023) illustrated this by demonstrating that the histopathologically confirmed LOAD yielded higher heritability estimates (31% - 57%) compared to clinically diagnosed LOAD (12% - 32%) when applying a consistent model with a 5% liability threshold to five independent cohorts [ 79 ]. LDAK estimates generally aligned more closely with GCTA, and estimates derived from LDAK were generally higher than LDSC. As an example, heritability estimates using data from Kunkle et al (2019) increased from 7% with LDSC ( Table 3 ) to 21% using LDAK [ 99 ]. ## GCTA. extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD) – LDSC overall range (review summary)
extractions.method_detail: Range of summary-statistic based SNP-heritability (LDSC) across studies reviewed
extractions.source_text: “In contrast, SNP-based approaches that compute heritability estimates based on measured genetic variants across the genome, provided relatively lower estimates (3.1% to 53%), as they are limited by w
extractions.evidence_html: ...effects that are difficult to dissect. This potentially leads to an overestimation of heritability. In contrast, SNP-based approaches that compute heritability estimates based on measured genetic variants across the genome, provided relatively lower estimates (3.1% to 53%), as they are limited by what has been genotyped or imputed [ 58 ]. Among them, studies using summary statistics provided relatively lower estimates (LDSC-based; 3.1% to 13%) compared with those using genotyped or imputed data (GCTA-based; 19% to 53%). As we recognize that LDSC-based heritability estimates tend to be downwardly biased [ 86 , 101 , 11...

extractions.title: Similarities and differences between Alzheimer's disease and schizophrenia: drug target Mendelian randomization and transcriptome analysis.

extractions.trait: Alzheimer's disease
extractions.method_detail: LDSC was used on AD GWAS summary statistics to estimate SNP-heritability and then genetic correlation with schizophrenia; the paper does not report the numerical h² estimate.
extractions.source_text: "Linkage Disequilibrium Score Regression (LDSC) was performed to first estimate the heritability of two traits, Alzheimer's disease (AD) and schizophrenia (SZ), and subsequently calculate the genetic

extractions.trait: Schizophrenia
extractions.method_detail: LDSC was used on SZ GWAS summary statistics to estimate SNP-heritability and then genetic correlation with Alzheimer's disease; the paper does not report the numerical h² estimate.
